etymology.description: 通(through) + 心(center) + 菜(vegetable) = vegetable with a hollow center (water spinach).
etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘through-heart vegetable,’ pointing to its hollow stems. 通心 here means ‘hollow-tubed,’ as in 通心粉 (hollow pasta), so the name highlights the plant’s tube-like stalks.

examples.chinese: 今天买了一把通心菜(今天買了一把通心菜)。
examples.pinyin: jīntiān mǎi le yì bǎ tōngxīncài.
examples.english: I bought a bunch of water spinach today.

examples.chinese: 通心菜的茎是中空的，所以容易入味(通心菜的莖是中空的，所以容易入味)。
examples.pinyin: tōngxīncài de jīng shì zhōngkōng de, suǒyǐ róngyì rùwèi.
examples.english: The stems are hollow, so flavors seep in easily.

examples.chinese: 我最爱清炒蒜蓉通心菜(我最愛清炒蒜蓉通心菜)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ zuì ài qīngchǎo suànróng tōngxīncài.
examples.english: I love stir-fried water spinach with garlic.
